mcq.statement: What does the idiom 'just as soon' imply when someone says 'I would just as soon stay home as go out tonight'?

options.a: They prefer to go out tonight
options.b: They have no preference between staying home or going out
options.c: They want to stay home because they feel unwell
options.d: They are undecided about their plans

mcq.one_liner: The idiom 'just as soon' indicates a lack of preference, suggesting the person would be equally satisfied with either of the two options presented.
